intro: Uapaca guineensis var. sudanica, commonly known as the Sudanese velvet bean, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible pods that contain seeds used in traditional medicine and as a food source. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
